moTa: The RAM ProMaster 1500 is available as a cargo van. The 2018 ProMaster 1500 starts at $29,995 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $1,645. The RAM ProMaster 1500 competes against models like the Chevrolet Express 2500, Ford Transit-150, and Ford Transit-350. The ProMaster 1500 is a good fit for towing Towing vehicles can tow a minimum of 2,000 pounds (see specifications for maximum). May require specific trim level and/or optional features. .

The RAM ProMaster 2500 is available as a cargo van. The 2018 ProMaster 2500 starts at $33,495 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $1,645. The RAM ProMaster 2500 competes against models like the Ford Transit-150, Chevrolet Express 2500, and RAM ProMaster 3500. The ProMaster 2500 is a good fit for towing Towing vehicles can tow a minimum of 2,000 pounds (see specifications for maximum). May require specific trim level and/or optional features. .

The RAM ProMaster City is available as a cargo van, wagon and passenger van. The 2018 ProMaster City starts at $23,995 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $1,545. It gets EPA-estimated 24 MPG combined. The RAM ProMaster City competes against models like the Chevrolet City Express, Nissan NV Cargo NV2500 HD, and Nissan NV200. The ProMaster City is a good fit for towing Towing vehicles can tow a minimum of 2,000 pounds (see specifications for maximum). May require specific trim level and/or optional features. .

The RAM 1500 is available as a crew cab and regular cab. The 2019 1500 starts at $31,695 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $1,645. The RAM 1500 competes against models like the Ford F-450, Honda Ridgeline, and Ford F-350. The 1500 is a good fit for off road shoppers Off-Road vehicles include four-wheel-drive SUVs and pickup trucks with the extra feature of a dual-range transfer case or dedicated crawl mode for extreme off-road driving.
